summary: This document is an email chain from August 9, 2019, between a CNBC reporter and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The reporter inquires about an investigation into allegations that Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds from Leslie Wexner and his family, and that Epstein's $46 million charitable donation was a fraction of the money taken. The DOJ spokesperson declines to comment on ongoing investigative matters.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.role: Spokesman, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the DOJ spokesperson who responds to the CNBC reporter's inquiry, declining to confirm or comment on any ongoing investigative matters per Department policy.

persons.name: Daniel Mangan
persons.context: He is the CNBC reporter who sends the initial inquiry email, asking about an investigation into allegations that Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds from Leslie Wexner and his family.

persons.name: Brian Schwartz
persons.context: He is copied on the email correspondence between Daniel Mangan and Nicholas Biase.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the subject of the reporter's inquiry, specifically regarding allegations that he misappropriated funds from Leslie Wexner and his family, and that his $46 million charitable donation was a fraction of the money taken.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: He and his family are identified as the alleged victims from whom Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds, according to the reporter's inquiry.

connections.description: The document references allegations that Epstein misappropriated funds from Wexner and his family, indicating a financial relationship where Epstein is accused of stealing from Wexner.
They are engaged in a professional correspondence, with Mangan as a reporter making an inquiry and Biase as a DOJ spokesperson responding.

events.title: CNBC inquiry about Epstein-Wexner investigation
events.description: CNBC reporter Daniel Mangan emails the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to inquire about an investigation into allegations that Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds from Leslie Wexner and his family.

keyFacts: A CNBC reporter inquired about an investigation into allegations that Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds from Leslie Wexner and his family.
The inquiry claimed that Epstein's $46 million donation to charity was only a fraction of the money he allegedly took from Wexner.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York declined to confirm or comment on any ongoing investigative matters.
The email correspondence indicates that Wexner and his legal team had reportedly turned over documentation of their claims to the U.S. Attorney's Office.
